title: 350+ Fun Trivia Questions & Answers for Teens

steps.title: Test a movie-lover’s knowledge with these tricky questions.
steps.content: Test a movie-lover’s knowledge with these tricky questions. These trivia questions will prove just how much your pals know about cinema. Challenge them with questions about classic films, or pick their brains about the latest releases: Question: Who directed the 2023 blockbuster Barbie ? Answer: Greta Gerwig. Question: What character does Robert Downey Jr. play in Oppenheimer ? Answer: Lewis Strauss. Question: Who played Jack Dawson in Titanic ? Answer: Leonardo DiCaprio. Question: What’s the name of the department store Buddy works at in Elf? Answer: Gimbels. Question: What is the name of Han Solo’s ship in Star Wars ? Answer: The Millennium Falcon. Question: On what day do the Plastics wear pink in Mean Girls ? Answer: Wednesday. Question: What is the name of Elsa and Anna’s kingdom in Frozen ? Answer: Arendelle. Question: What kitchen object does Rapunzel use for self-defence in Tangled ? Answer: A frying pan. Question: How many infinity stones does Thanos collect to destroy half the universe? Answer: Six. Question: The code in The Matrix comes from what food recipes? Answer: Sushi. Question: Who voices Joy in Inside Out ? Answer: Amy Poehler. Question: Which country does Forrest Gump travel to as a part of the All-American Ping-Pong Team? Answer: China. Question: Freddy Krueger wears a striped sweater in what colors? Answer: Red and green. Question: What score did Elle Woods get on her LSAT in Legally Blonde ? Answer: 179. Question: Who directed the 2017 movie Get Out ? Answer: Jordan Peele. Question: What item is in every Fight Club scene? Answer: A Starbucks cup. Question: Which is the first movie in the Austin Powers franchise? Answer: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery. Question: In Mean Girls, Cady moves to Illinois from which continent? Answer: Africa. Question: In The Ring , how long do people have to live after they’ve watched the cursed tape? Answer: Seven days. Question: What song plays in the tunnel scene of Perks of Being a Wallflower ? Answer: “Heroes” by David Bowie. Question: Which was the first movie to show a toilet flushing? Answer: Psycho. Question: What was the first feature-length animated movie ever released? Answer: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs. Question: What was the first movie of the Marvel Cinematic Universe? Answer: Iron Man. Question: Which actor was the first Spider-Man character? Answer: Tobey Maguire. Question: What year was the first Star Wars film released? Answer: 1977. Question: Who starred as Batman in 2022’s The Batman ? Answer: Robert Pattinson. Question: Who was the first villain in Pirates of the Caribbean ? Answer: Hector Barbossa.

steps.title: Challenge binge-watchers with these questions about TV shows.
steps.content: Challenge binge-watchers with these questions about TV shows. Do you have friends who seem to have watched and seen everything that ever aired? Well, put their knowledge to the test with these trivia questions: Question: The popular quote “That’s what she said” is from what 2000’s TV show? Answer: The Office. Question: What was the first TV series to be produced for Netflix? Answer: House of Cards. Question: What grade does Janine Teagues teach in Abbott Elementary ? Answer: Second. Question: What is the name of the coffee shop in Friends ? Answer: Central Perk. Question: Who is the main character in Breaking Bad ? Answer: Walter White. Question: Which TV show ends by suddenly cutting to black? Answer: The Sopranos. Question: What TV family is composed of Mike, Carol, Greg, Marcia, Peter, Jan, Bobby, and Cindy? Answer: The Brady Bunch. Question: Which state is the Stranger Things set in? Answer: Hawkins, Indiana. Question: Which Nickelodeon cartoon character does Tom Kenny voice? Answer: SpongeBob SquarePants. Question: What is the name of Bart Simpson’s teacher on The Simpsons ? Answer: Mrs. Krabappel. Question: Which main character in Friends never got married? Answer: Joey. Question: What is the name of Sabrina’s cat in Sabrina the Teenage Witch ? Answer: Salem. Question: What is the name of Negan’s bat in The Walking Dead ? Answer: Lucille. Question: What is the Munsters’ address? Answer: 1313 Mockingbird Lane Question: South Park takes place in which state? Answer: Colorado. Question: What is the name of Winston’s cat in New Girl ? Answer: Ferguson. Question: What is the name of Toby’s daughter in The Office ? Answer: Sasha. Question: On The Good Place , Jason Mendoza is a fan of which NFL team? Answer: Jacksonville Jaguars. Question: On The Big Bang Theory , Penny is a waitress at which restaurant? Answer: Cheesecake Factory. Question: What TV show invented the rerun to allow its star time to recover from pregnancy? Answer: I Love Lucy. Question: What is the name of the famously angry host of Hell’s Kitchen ? Answer: Gordon Ramsay. Question: Where does SpongeBob SquarePants work? Answer: The Krusty Krab. Question: Who hosted America’s Next Top Model ? Answer: Tyra Banks. Question: What was the first network in the United States to have 24-hour news? Answer: CNN. Question: Kelly Clarkson, Taylor Hicks, and David Cook are winners of what TV show? Answer: American Idol. Question: On which show do the characters work at Dunder Mifflin Paper Company, Inc.? Answer: The Office. Question: What cartoon had the main characters Fred, Barney, Wilma, and Betty? Answer: The Flintstones.

steps.title: Quiz a music lover on songs, artists, and genres.
steps.content: Quiz a music lover on songs, artists, and genres. These trivia questions are perfect for die-hard music fans! Challenge them with questions about oldies, or stick with questions about today’s music to see if they’re up to date. Question: What instrument does Lizzo play? Answer: The flute. Question: Which artist is known for singing “Good Luck, Babe!”? Answer: Chappell Roan. Question: Who is the lead singer of the band Coldplay? Answer: Chris Martin. Question: How many shows did Taylor Swift perform on The Eras Tour? Answer: 149 shows. Question: Which artist is the best-selling female country artist of all time? Answer: Shania Twain. Question: What was the first video played on MTV in 1981? Answer: “Video Killed the Radio Star.” Question: Who released the song “Never Gonna Give You Up” in 1987? Answer: Rick Astley. Question: What was The Spice Girls’ number one hit in 1997? Answer: “Wannabe.” Question: Which Celine Dion song won Best Original Song at the 1998 Oscars? Answer: “My Heart Will Go On?” Question: Who sang “Wonderwall”? Answer: Oasis. Question: What is the name of the bass guitarist for the Red Hot Chili Peppers? Answer: Flea. Question: Before becoming famous, where did Harry Styles work? Answer: A bakery. Question: What’s the name of Billie Eilish’s singer-songwriter brother? Answer: Finneas. Question: Who performed the Super Bowl halftime show in 2021? Answer: The Weeknd. Question: What country is Rihanna from? Answer: Barbados. Question: What is Elton John’s real name? Answer: Reginald Kenneth Dwight. Question: Elvis Presley cut his first single at which Memphis recording studio? Answer: Sun Studio. Question: What is Taylor Swift’s middle name? Answer: Alison. Question: Ozzy Osbourne was in what heavy metal band? Answer: Black Sabbath. Question: Patrick Stump is the lead singer of what band? Answer: Fall Out Boy. Question: What state is Bruce Springsteen from? Answer: New Jersey. Question: The movie Coal Miner’s Daughter is based on the life of which country artist? Answer: Loretta Lynn. Question: What city are The Beatles from? Answer: Liverpool. Question: Which award show did Lady Gaga wear her infamous meat dress? Answer: MTV Music Awards. Question: What is the first ABBA song sung in Mamma Mia ? Answer: “Honey, Honey.” Question: Who was the first member of One Direction to leave the group? Answer: Zayn Malik. Question: What musical contest first started in 1956? Answer: The Eurovision Song Contest.

steps.title: Encourage a sports fan to think about their favorite team’s history.
steps.content: Encourage a sports fan to think about their favorite team’s history. Keep sports fanatics on their toes with these trivia questions about sports traditions, history, and rules: Question: How many players can a team have on the field at one time in football? Answer: 11. Question: Which athlete has the most medals in Olympic history? Answer: Michael Phelps. Question: How many points do you have if you bowled a perfect game? Answer: 300. Question: Which major league baseball team has won the most World Series? Answer: The New York Yankees. Question: How many games does each team play during a regular NFL season? Answer: 17. Question: Which baseball player is nicknamed “The Great Bambino”? Answer: Babe Ruth. Question: Which sport uses a pommel horse? Answer: Gymnastics. Question: What inning is “Take Me Out to the Ballgame” traditionally sung? Answer: The 7th inning. Question: What body part can’t touch the ball in soccer? Answer: Hands. Question: What is the nickname of the college basketball playoff tournament? Answer: March Madness. Question: Where does an NFL player score a touchdown? Answer: The end zone. Question: How many holes are there in an average round of golf? Answer: 18. Question: What does NFL stand for? Answer: National Football League. Question: What does the winner of the Masters receive? Answer: The Green Jacket. Question: How tall is the standard basketball hoop? Answer: 10 feet. Question: How many rings are in the Olympics logo? Answer: Five. Question: What stadium do the Boston Red Sox play at? Answer: Fenway Park. Question: How old was Tiger Woods when he won his first Masters Tournament? Answer: 21. Question: What country has the most Olympic gold medals? Answer: The United States. Question: Who is the all-time leading scorer in NBA history? Answer: LeBron James. Question: Who won the first-ever Super Bowl? Answer: The Green Bay Packers. Question: Which NBA team has won the most championships? Answer: The Los Angeles Lakers. Question: Who is the record holder for the most Formula 1 World Championship titles? Answer: Lewis Hamilton. Question: In which sport do ricochets occur? Answer: Basketball. Question: How many minutes are in one period of hockey? Answer: 20 minutes. Question: How many matches are there in a set of tennis? Answer: 6. Question: Which country hosted the Winter Olympics in 2014? Answer: Russia.

steps.title: Test a history buff’s knowledge of American history.
steps.content: Test a history buff’s knowledge of American history. See how much your friends have been paying attention in class with these trivia questions about US history and current events: [1] X Research source Question: Who was the first president of the United States? Answer: George Washington. Question: Who gave the famous “I Have a Dream” speech? Answer: Martin Luther King Jr. Question: Which US president gave the Gettysburg Address? Answer: Abraham Lincoln. Question: Who was the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean? Answer: Amelia Earhart. Question: Where was the Declaration of Independence signed? Answer: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Question: Abraham Lincoln was assassinated in which theater? Answer: Ford’s Theater. Question: The group of men who wrote the Declaration of Independence are known as what? Answer: The Founding Fathers. Question: Benjamin Franklin is known for inventing what kind of glasses? Answer: Bifocals. Question: What year was the Constitution written? Answer: 1787. Question: What branch of government contains the Office of the President? Answer: Executive branch. Question: What is America’s national anthem called? Answer: “The Star Spangled Banner.” Question: Who created the first American flag? Answer: Betsy Ross. Question: What do the 13 stripes on the American flag represent? Answer: The 13 original colonies. Question: Who was the first president to live in the White House? Answer: John Adams. Question: What year was the 13th Amendment ratified? Answer: 1865. Question: What was the name of the first successful colony in America? Answer: Jamestown. Question: Which is the smallest American state? Answer: Rhode Island. Question: How many independent states are in the USA? Answer: 50. Question: Who was the second president of the United States? Answer: John Adams. Question: Which state is Mount Rushmore located in? Answer: South Dakota. Question: What was the United States called in the 1600s? Answer: The New World. Question: What are the first 10 amendments of the Constitution called? Answer: The Bill of Rights. Question: What is the oldest European-founded city in the United States? Answer: St. Augustine, Florida. Question: Who did Pocahontas marry? Answer: John Rolfe. Question: What was the name of the Pilgrims’ ship? Answer: The Mayflower. Question: What was the date of the Boston Tea Party? Answer: December 16, 1773. Question: What city was the first capital of the United States? Answer: New York City.

steps.title: Quiz your pals on world news.
steps.content: Quiz your pals on world news. These trivia questions are sure to be puzzling, especially if your friends have been paying attention in history class! Test their knowledge on world history with these questions: [2] X Research source Question: Who was the first emperor of China? Answer: Qin Shi Huang. Question: What was the capital of the Aztec Empire? Answer: Tenochtitlan. Question: Which British queen holds the longest reign before Queen Elizabeth II? Answer: Queen Victoria. Question: Who was the first emperor of Japan? Answer: Emperor Jimmu. Question: What year did the Berlin Wall go up? Answer: 1961. Question: Who painted the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel? Answer: Michelangelo. Question: What year did World War II begin? Answer: 1939. Question: What year was the Great Fire of London? Answer: 1666. Question: Who was the last monarch of the Tudor dynasty? Answer: Elizabeth I. Question: What was the name of Genghis Khan’s empire? Answer: The Mongol Empire. Question: What was the main language spoken in ancient Rome? Answer: Latin. Question: How long did the 100-Year War last? Answer: 116 years. Question: In which country was Mozart born? Answer: Austria. Question: What year did the French Revolution start? Answer: 1789. Question: Which civilization invented the wheel? Answer: The Sumerians. Question: What country is famous for its Terracotta Army and Great Wall? Answer: China. Question: Who is known as “The Father of Medicine”? Answer: Hippocrates. [3] X Research source Question: In which country did the Battle of Waterloo take place? Answer: Belgium. Question: What was the name of the last queen of France? Answer: Marie Antoinette. Question: What ancient wonder of the world in Greece is dedicated to Athena? Answer: The Parthenon. Question: How many hills were there in the ancient city of Rome? Answer: Seven. Question: Who was Alexander the Great’s teacher? Answer: Aristotle. Question: What is the longest wall in the world? Answer: The Great Wall of China. Question: What is considered the longest empire in history? Answer: The Mongol Empire. Question: During which war was the Christmas Truce called? Answer: World War I. Question: What was the capital city of the Inca Empire? Answer: Cusco. Question: Who was the first emperor of Rome? Answer: Augustus. Question: How old was King Tutankhamun when he died? Answer: 19. Want to further test your knowledge? Check out our World History Trivia Quiz !

steps.title: Discover how well your friends know a world map.
steps.content: Discover how well your friends know a world map. These questions can be tricky for those who haven’t traveled, but they’re full of fun and interesting facts! Use these geography trivia questions as a challenge: [4] X Research source Question: Which river is the longest in the world? Answer: The Nile River. Question: Which desert is the largest in the world? Answer: The Antarctic Desert. Question: Which continent is the only one without an active volcano? Answer: Australia. Question: Which country has the most natural lakes? Answer: Canada. Question: What is the longest mountain range in the world? Answer: The Andes Mountains. Question: Which countries are in both Europe and Asia? Answer: Turkey and Russia. Question: Which US state has the most active volcanoes? Answer: Alaska. Question: What is the most populous city in the world? Answer: Tokyo, Japan. Question: Which African country has the largest population? Answer: Nigeria. Question: Which European country has the longest coastline? Answer: Norway. Question: What is the highest mountain in the world? Answer: Mount Everest. Question: Which country has the ancient ruins of Machu Picchu? Answer: Peru. Question: Where can you find the Colosseum? Answer: Rome, Italy. Question: Which US state is home to the Grand Canyon? Answer: Arizona. Question: Where is the Taj Mahal located? Answer: Agra, India. Question: The Pyramids of Giza are located near which major city? Answer: Cairo, Egypt. Question: Which river runs through the Grand Canyon? Answer: The Colorado River. Question: What is the highest waterfall in the world? Answer: Angel Falls in Venezuela. Question: Which lake is the largest in the world? Answer: The Caspian Sea. Question: What is the world’s deepest ocean trench? Answer: The Mariana Trench. Question: What is the largest hot desert in the world? Answer: The Sahara Desert. Question: What is the tallest mountain in North America? Answer: Denali (Mount McKinley). Question: What’s the world’s largest country by physical size? Answer: Russia. Question: What’s the largest volcano in the world? Answer: Mauna Loa. Question: What is the most populated city in the United States? Answer: New York City. Question: What modern-day Italian city is next to Mount Vesuvius? Answer: Naples. Question: Where is the Golden Gate Bridge located? Answer: San Francisco.

steps.title: Test your mad scientist skills with these trivia questions.
steps.content: Test your mad scientist skills with these trivia questions. Whether your friends are science whizzes or not, they’re sure to learn something new with these questions! Ask these science questions to see who’s been paying the most attention in class: Question: How much does a cloud weigh? Answer: Around 1 million pounds! Question: Which metal is at the center of the Earth? Answer: Iron. Question: How old is the sun? Answer: 4.6 billion years. Question: Who discovered the laws of motion? Answer: Sir Isaac Newton. Question: What is the least common blood type in America? Answer: AB negative. Question: How many elements are on the periodic table? Answer: 118. Question: What galaxy does Earth belong to? Answer: The Milky Way. Question: How many bones are in the human body? Answer: 206. Question: At what temperature does water boil? Answer: 212 °F (100 °C). Question: What is the process of plants converting sunlight into energy called? Answer: Photosynthesis. Question: What is the largest planet? Answer: Jupiter. Question: What is the smallest unit of matter? Answer: Atoms. Question: What does the Richter scale measure? Answer: The magnitude of earthquakes. Question: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth? Answer: Diamond. Question: Where is the smallest bone in your body located? Answer: The ear. Question: What is the largest organ in the human body? Answer: Skin. Question: What is the most abundant gas in the Earth’s atmosphere? Answer: Nitrogen. Question: How long does it take for sunlight to reach Earth? Answer: 8 minutes. Question: What are the four states of matter? Answer: Solid, liquid, gas, and plasma. Question: What is the chemical symbol for water? Answer: H2O. Question: What is known as the powerhouse of the cell? Answer: The mitochondria. Question: How many bones are in the human body? Answer: 206. [5] X Research source Question: What are the three layers of the Earth? Answer: Crust, mantle, and core. Question: What do you call the study of weather? Answer: Meteorology. Question: What is the study of fungi called? Answer: Mycology. Question: What do you call a volcano that’s not currently erupting? Answer: Dormant. Question: What element is the most commonly used to create nuclear energy? Answer: Uranium.

steps.title: Keep an animal-lover on their toes with these questions.
steps.content: Keep an animal-lover on their toes with these questions. These trivia questions feature adorable critters and ferocious predators, making them perfect for any and all animal lovers! Test their knowledge with these fun questions: Question: What is the closest living relative to the T-Rex? Answer: The chicken. Question: How many legs do ants have? Answer: Six. Question: Which US state has the largest population of black bears? Answer: Alaska. Question: What is the smartest animal on the planet? Answer: The chimpanzee. Question: What color is a zebra’s skin? Answer: Black. Question: How many teeth does an adult wolf have? Answer: 42. Question: What is the primary diet of a panda? Answer: Bamboo. Question: How many claws does the average house cat have? Answer: 18. Question: How many volts of energy can electric eels produce? Answer: 800 volts. Question: How many bones do sharks have? Answer: None. Question: What’s the average lifespan of a hamster? Answer: 2 years. Question: What is the fear of animals called? Answer: Zoophobia. Question: How many hearts does an octopus have? Answer: Three. Question: Which country has the largest population of tigers? Answer: India. Question: What is the name of a group of porcupines? Answer: A prickle. Question: What’s the world’s largest land animal? Answer: The African bush elephant. Question: What color is a lobster’s blood? Answer: Blue. Question: How many teeth does a seahorse have? Answer: Zero. Question: What animal is known for its ability to change color? Answer: The chameleon. Question: What animal has the most teeth? Answer: A snail. Question: Which animal sleeps the most? Answer: The koala bear. Question: What is a group of lions called? Answer: A pride. Question: What is the fastest animal on land? Answer: Cheetah. Question: What animal has the highest blood pressure? Answer: Giraffe. Question: Which mammal has the thickest fur? Answer: Sea otter. Question: What is the smallest mammal in the world? Answer: Bumblebee bat. Question: How far away can a wolf smell its prey? Answer: Almost two miles.

steps.title: Gain a life by answering these gaming-themed questions.
steps.content: Gain a life by answering these gaming-themed questions. These trivia questions are perfect for avid gamers! Test their knowledge on the latest game releases, or stick with questions full of retro vibes and nostalgia. Question: Which video game franchise has a character named Mario? Answer: Super Mario Bros. Question: What is the main enemy faction in “Halo”? Answer: The Covenant. Question: Which game features a hacker protagonist named Aiden Pearce? Answer: Watch Dogs. Question: What is the name of the princess Link has to save in The Legend of Zelda franchise? Answer: Princess Zelda. Question: Which game is set in the post-apocalyptic wasteland of Boston? Answer: Fallout 4. Question: Who is Mario’s brother? Answer: Luigi. Question: In which game do players use a Portal Gun to create spatial shortcuts? Answer: Portal. Question: What is the main resource you need to collect in Minecraft? Answer: Wood. Question: What game has a protagonist named Commander Shepard? Answer: Mass Effect. Question: In what game do you play as a member of the Desmond Miles lineage? Answer: Assassin’s Creed. Question: Which game features creatures called Clickers? Answer: The Last of Us. Question: Which game features a land called Azeroth? Answer: World of Warcraft. Question: What is the currency in Animal Crossing called? Answer: Bells. Question: Which game features a protagonist named Lara Croft? Answer: Tomb Raider. Question: In which game do you explore the city of Dunwall? Answer: Dishonored. Question: In what year was Asteroids released? Answer: 1979. Question: What classic arcade game features a character who jumps on cubes to change their colors? Answer: Qbert. Question: What is the name of the final course of all Mario Kart games? Answer: Rainbow Road. Question: What type of animal is Isabelle in Animal Crossing ? Answer: Dog. Question: When was the first Call of Duty released? Answer: 2003. Question: Where’s the best place to meet wild Pokémon? Answer: Tall grass. Question: Who invented the video game? Answer: William Higinbotham. Question: What color is Sonic the Hedgehog? Answer: Blue. Question: Who is on the cover of Madden NFL 18 ? Answer: Tom Brady. Question: What is the highest level a player can reach in Pac-Man ? Answer: 256. Question: Nintendo began as a company selling what products? Answer: Playing cards. Question: How many different shapes are there in Tetris ? Answer: 7.

steps.title: Test a friend’s knowledge on current viral moments.
steps.content: Test a friend’s knowledge on current viral moments. Have a pal who’s obsessed with Instagram, TikTok, and all the gossip? If so, these questions are perfect for them! These trivia questions are full of pop culture references and viral online moments: Question: What year was the iPhone released? Answer: 2007. Question: What are the names of Kim Kardashian and Kanye West’s kids? Answer: North, Saint, Chicago, and Psalm. Question: Around how many TikToks are watched every day? Answer: About 1 billion. Question: What is Lady Gaga’s real name? Answer: Stefani Germanotta. Question: What are the official titles of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle? Answer: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex. Question: In 2017, La La Land was mistakenly announced as Best Picture at the Academy Awards. What film actually won? Answer: Moonlight. Question: Which SNL alumni did Kim Kardashian notably date? Answer: Pete Davidson. Question: What pop singer topped the Billboard Hot 100 for 15 weeks with the single “As It Was”? Answer: Harry Styles. Question: Joe Exotic is the focus of what Netflix documentary series? Answer: Tiger King. Question: Taylor Swift is named after what singer-songwriter? Answer: James Taylor. Question: What colorful, squishy, plush toy was released in 2017 with over 1000 characters and variations? Answer: Squishmallow. Question: In 2023, what purple ice cream drink gained popularity after influencers pretended to die after drinking it? Answer: The Grimace Shake. Question: What city was Beyoncé born in? Answer: Houston, Texas. Question: What 2022 fashion trend includes wearing shades of pink, tulle, and flat shoes? Answer: Balletcore. Question: What actress has a habit of falling over at big occasions, most famously on her way to get her first Oscar? Answer: Jennifer Lawrence. Question: What is Eminem’s real name? Answer: Marshall Mathers Question: Which famous Emma’s real name is Emily? Answer: Emma Stone. Question: Which tech entrepreneur named his son X Æ A-12? Answer: Elon Musk. Question: Who won the People’s title of “Sexiest Man Alive” in 2024? Answer: John Krasinski. Question: Which fashion magazine is known for its September issue? Answer: Vogue. Question: What space transportation company was founded in 2002 by Elon Musk? Answer: SpaceX. Question: What is the most downloaded AI app? Answer: ChatGPT. Question: Who won the Best Actor Oscar in 2016? Answer: Leonardo DiCaprio. Question: Who interrupted Taylor Swift’s speech at the 2009 MTV Video Music Awards? Answer: Kanye West. Question: Which celebrity couple broke up in 2020 after a decade-long relationship? Answer: Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie. Question: What Friends haircut was popular in the 1990s? Answer: The Rachel. Question: What 1994-95 murder trial captivated the nation for over 11 months? Answer: O.J. Simpson vs. The People.

steps.title: Stay trendy with these trivia questions.
steps.content: Stay trendy with these trivia questions. These questions are full of LOL moments and nostalgia. Take a trip down memory lane by testing your knowledge of internet culture. Question: The meme of Will Ferrell saying, “Well, that escalated quickly,” comes from what 2004 movie? Answer: Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy. Question: What three words are written under a cartoon image of a dog drinking coffee in a room on fire? Answer: “This is fine.” Question: Which muppet character sips on tea in the “but that’s none of my business” meme? Answer: Kermit the Frog. Question: Which athlete was turned into a crying meme after an emotional speech at his Basketball Hall of Fame induction? Answer: Michael Jordan. Question: The meme of Steve Carell saying, “Why are you the way that you are?” comes from what TV show? Answer: The Office. Question: The “ice bucket challenge” went viral in 2014 to promote awareness of what disease? Answer: ALS. Question: What character is depicted in a cartoon pointing at three versions of himself? Answer: Spider-Man. Question: Which Korean pop song and horseback-riding dance by PSY went viral worldwide in 2012? Answer: Gangnam Style. Question: A clip of which Top Gun star jumping on Oprah’s couch is a viral meme? Answer: Tom Cruise. Question: The meme “It’s gonna be May” comes from a song by what band? Answer: NSYNC. Question: In a viral 2007 YouTube video, what does Charlie’s little brother do to him? Answer: Bit his finger. Question: Which past social media app started the meme “What are thooooose?!” Answer: Vine. Question: What rapper is the center of the “Hotline Bling” meme? Answer: Drake. Question: The meme “Ermahgerd Girl” features a girl holding three books from what series? Answer: Goosebumps . Question: What 17-year-old gorilla was mythologized in 2016 memes for protecting a boy from his enclosure? Answer: Harambe. Question: Which actor portraying Willy Wonka is in the “Condescending Wonka” meme? Answer: Gene Wilder. Question: What type of fruit dances to “Peanut Butter Jelly Time”? Answer: Banana. Question: The “Shut up and take my money!” meme is a reference to what animated series? Answer: Futurama. Question: What talk show did Danielle Bregoli (the “cash me outside, how ‘bout that” girl) first appear on? Answer: Dr. Phil. Question: Who released a pop music video about Friday in 2011? Answer: Rebecca Black. Question: What is Grumpy Cat’s official name? Answer: Tardar Sauce. Question: The meme line “ludicrously capricious bag” comes from what HBO drama? Answer: Succession.

steps.title: Flip through the pages of your mind to uncover the answers to these questions.
steps.content: Flip through the pages of your mind to uncover the answers to these questions. Book lovers of all ages will be puzzled and stumped by these reading-themed trivia questions. Test their knowledge of classic literature, or opt for questions about recent viral books. Question: Who wrote To Kill a Mockingbird ? Answer: Harper Lee. Question: Who is the author of The Lord of the Rings series? Answer: J.R.R. Tolkien. Question: The Da Vinci Code opens with a murder in which museum? Answer: The Louvre. Question: Divergent is set in the post-apocalyptic version of which American city? Answer: Chicago. Question: What is the best-selling novel of all time? Answer: Don Quixote. Question: What novel is set on a desert planet inhabited by sandworms? Answer: Dune. Question: Which Stephen King novel takes place in the Overlook Hotel? Answer: The Shining. Question: Which author wrote his last novel in crayon? Answer: James Joyce. Question: The book Water for Elephants takes place in what era? Answer: The 1930s. Question: Wuthering Heights tells the tragic romance of which lovers? Answer: Catherine and Heathcliff. Question: Who wrote Rip Van Winkle ? Answer: Washington Irving. Question: What century was John Milton’s Paradise Lost written? Answer: 1700s. Question: Who is Leopold Bloom’s wife in Ulysses ? Answer: Molly. Question: What’s the name of the monster Beowulf faces? Answer: Grendel. Question: What is the name of John’s true love in Nicholas Sparks’ Dear John ? Answer: Savannah. Question: What was the first novel ever written? Answer: The Tale of Genji . Question: What was the original title of Ray Bradbury’s Fahrenheit 451 ? Answer: The Fireman. Question: Who wrote The Book Thief ? Answer: Markus Zusak. Question: What year was Of Mice and Men published? Answer: 1937. Question: Who is the protagonist of The Hunger Games ? Answer: Katniss Everdeen. Question: Which character is pregnant at the beginning of The Grapes of Wrath ? Answer: Rose of Sharon. Question: What novel begins with “Call me Ishmael”? Answer: Moby Dick. Question: Who wrote the fairy tale “The Ugly Duckling”? Answer: Hans Christian Andersen. Question: Who wrote Gone with the Wind ? Answer: Margaret Mitchell. Question: Who declined the 1964 Nobel Prize for literature? Answer: Jean-Paul Sartre. Question: What musical instrument did Sherlock Holmes play? Answer: Violin. Question: Who wrote Twilight ? Answer: Stephenie Meyer. Question: Sydney Carton is a character in which Charles Dickens novel? Answer: A Tale of Two Cities.

steps.title: Feed the brain with these food-themed trivia questions.
steps.content: Feed the brain with these food-themed trivia questions. These questions are packed full of trivia goodness! Learn something new about your favorite foods and cuisines with these fun questions: Question: Is a tomato a fruit or a vegetable? Answer: Fruit. Question: What part of the plant is a potato? Answer: The stem. Question: What is deer meat called? Answer: Venison. Question: What is the main ingredient in hummus? Answer: Chickpeas. Question: What American city is most famous for its deep-dish pizza? Answer: Chicago. Question: What year was the chocolate chip cookie invented? Answer: 1938. [6] X Research source Question: What is the most used spice in the world? Answer: Black pepper. Question: What is the most popular pizza topping in America? Answer: Pepperoni. [7] X Research source Question: What is the most popular potato chip brand in the United States? Answer: Lay’s. Question: What is the most ordered item at McDonald’s? Answer: French fries. Question: What is the fear of cooking called? Answer: Mageirocophobia. Question: How many tines does a standard dinner fork have? Answer: Four. Question: What is the most hated pizza topping in America? Answer: Anchovies. [8] X Research source Question: How many times a month does the average person eat out? Answer: 4. [9] X Research source Question: What was the first vegetable to ever grow in space? Answer: Potato. Question: How many pounds of milk are needed to make one pound of cheese? Answer: 10. Question: “Have it your way” is the slogan of what fast food restaurant? Answer: Burger King. Question: What kind of nut is used to make pesto? Answer: Pine nut. Question: Which US president had a love for jelly beans? Answer: Ronald Reagan. Question: Which country is the world’s largest producer of olive oil? Answer: Spain. Question: What is the technical name for a pizza crust? Answer: Cornicione. Question: Pancetta is made from the meat of what animal? Answer: Pig. Question: What expensive spice comes from crocus flowers? Answer: Saffron. Question: What is nori? Answer: Seaweed. Question: What sauce is used in traditional Eggs Benedict? Answer: Hollandaise. Question: What type of nut is used to make Nutella? Answer: Hazelnuts. Question: What type of cheese is traditionally used to make tiramisu? Answer: Mascarpone. Question: What month is National Ice Cream Month? Answer: July.
